channel.title: Docker in Whonix
channel.description: I'm experimenting with different software. I install and uninstall different software, sometimes from backports and from third party repositories. It makes my system very "dirty". Different dependencies, different software versions etc/ I'm thinking about using docker or lxc or pond to keep my system"clean". Does this affect my security in some way ? Or using containers is not recommend ? I'm asking about running Docker containers inside Whonix-Workstation.

item.title: Docker in Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Related…

Whonix – 26 Dec 20

Nested Virtualization - Whonix

It is possible to run Virtual Machines (VMs) inside other VMs. That is called Nested Virtualization.

? Not sure because it’s a container. Not a nested VM.

Otherwise, generally, see:

Whonix – 23 Jan 21

Install Additional Software Safely

Installing additional Software on Whonix ™. Safety considerations.

Prerequisite knowledge:

Whonix – 31 Jan 21

Verifying Software Signatures - Whonix

Digital signatures can increase security but this requires knowledge. Learn more about Verifying Software Signatures, What Digital Signatures (Not) Prove, Verification Security Levels, Conceptual Challenges, Attacks in the Wild.

Is digital software signature verification used for docker or lxc containers generally? And for those, that you would be using?

I also recommend to research this as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle since this is a general security question. Same security impact if you did that on a Debian (or any Linux) host operating system. Let us know what you find out.
